name: breakfast_suggestion
instruction: 아침 식사로 달걀을 포함하지 않으면서 단백질이 포함되고 칼로리가 700-1000칼로리 정도인 식품이 있나요?

instances.output: Yes, you can have 1 oatmeal banana protein shake and 4 strips of bacon. The oatmeal banana protein shake may contain 1/2 cup oatmeal, 60 grams whey protein powder, 1/2 medium banana, 1tbsp flaxseed oil and 1/2 cup watter, totalling about 550 calories. The 4 strips of bacon contains about 200 calories.

name: harmful_stereotype_example
instruction: 주어진 고정관념이 자신에게 해가 될 수 있는 상황을 설명하세요.

instances.input: "모든 아시아인은 똑똑하다!"
instances.output:
Imagine you're a small child of Asian descent. You hear your whole life how "all Asians are smart," but you know that does not feel like it's true for you. You have a hard time in school. Reading is difficult. Math is impossible. Everyone around you seems to pressure you because you are supposed to be "smart." Every time you do not bring home that "A" assignment, you feel like a failure. Like you alone missed out on the gene that makes "all Asians smart."
As educational opportunities like scholarships and colleges close their door on you, your future looks bleak. You have spent years trying to be the stereotypically smart Asian instead of finding the talents that could have taken you to success in other areas. As you can see, although the stereotype doesn't sound like a bad thing at first, it can put a lot of weight on the people who do not fit into it.

name: email_subject_generation
instruction: 다음 이메일에 적절한 주관적인 제목을 생성합니다:

instances.input:

최고,
[내 이름]
instances.output: Invitition to be a panelist for CVPR 2023 workshop on Multimodality

name: interview_question_answering
instruction: 면접에서 이 질문에 어떻게 대답하나요?

instances.input: 차 안에 혼자 있을 때 어떤 생각이 드시나요?
instances.output: If it is in the evening, I typically think about what good I have accomplished that day, and if it is in the morning, I think about how I can be my best that day. I also try to practice gratitude and live in the present moment while I'm driving to avoid distractions.

name: refuse_invitation_email
instruction: 이메일에 답장하고 초대를 정중하게 거절하세요.

instances.input:
다음은 이메일입니다. 

존경하는 ARR 검토자 여러분,
ARR에 대한 지속적인 지원에 감사드립니다. 현재 2022년 7월 주기(제출 마감일은 7월 15일, 정기 검토 마감일은 8월 21일)의 긴급 검토자 지원자를 모집하고 있습니다.
긴급 검토는 8월 21일부터 8월 28일까지 진행됩니다. 이 기간에 한 번 이상의 긴급 검토를 제공할 수 있는 경우(이 주기에 정기 검토자 배정 여부와 관계없이) 이 시트를 작성해 주세요(수술실 ID, 전문 분야, 작성 가능한 긴급 검토 건수 제공 해주세요).
모든 자원자에게 미리 감사드립니다!
감사합니다, 
ARR EiCs
instances.output:
Hello, 
Thank you for reaching out. Unfortunately, I am not available during that period to provide emergency reviews. 
Best, 
[Name]

name: explain_without-background
instruction: 해당 분야에 대한 배경 지식이 없는 사람들에게 주어진 주제의 연관성을 어떻게 설명하시겠습니까?

instances.input: 머신 러닝과 데이터 마이닝
instances.output: They are two very closely related fields of study that deal with extracting information from data. Machine Learning is concerned with the development of algorithms that can learn from data and make predictions about new data. Data Mining is concerned with the extraction of patterns and trends from data. Both fields make use of a variety of techniques, including statistics, artificial intelligence, and pattern recognition.

name: story_composition
instruction: 주어진 사실을 일관성 있고 흥미로운 스토리로 구성하세요.

instances.input:
사실: 
- 어떤 사람 X는 남아프리카공화국에서 태어났다.
- X는 행복한 어린 시절의 대부분을 친구들과 놀면서 보냈다.
- 대학 졸업 후에 프로그래밍을 배우기 시작했다. 
- X는 억만장자가 되었습니다.
instances.output: Entrepreneur PersonX has achieved great fame as the CEO of an international company. His company, the Dolphin, is one of the most profitable fintech companies in the US as of 2022. Despite his success in the fintech field, PersonX didn't start learning programming before his college. Born in a middle-class family in South Africa, PersonX spent most of his childhood hanging out with his friends, instead of playing on computers. "My dad didn't buy me a computer, so I had no idea about programming back then, " Person X told an interviewer. However, he really demonstrated his talent in programming after he went to college. He started his first startup in his second year, and that startup is later acquired by Microsoft.

name: exercise_explanation
instruction: 운동 이름이 주어지면 운동 방법을 설명하세요.

instances.input: 버피
instances.output: Starting with your feet shoulder-width apart, get down into a squat position. From a deep squat, put your hands down on the floor inside your feet and jump your feet back behind you, so you’re in a plank position, then do a push-up, touching your chest to the floor. Raise back up onto your arms in a plank, then jump your feet back in underneath your chest. Jump your feet outside your hands and as you stand up, jump up with your arms in the air. Aim for 10 reps.

name: suggestion_for_breaking_up
instruction: 여자친구와 헤어져서 너무 슬픕니다. 몇 가지 조언을 해주시겠어요?

instances.output:
I am so sorry for that! But here are a few things that could help you to get out of it:
1. Spend time with friends and family who make you feel good about yourself. 
2. Do things that make you happy. 
3. Avoid dwelling on negative thoughts by keeping yourself busy with positive activities. 
4. Talk to a therapist or counselor if you are struggling to cope with your sadness.

name: extract_country_names
instruction: 단락에 있는 모든 국가 이름을 추출하고 쉼표로 구분하여 나열합니다.

instances.input: 닥터 노는 영국 작가 이안 플레밍의 여섯 번째 소설로 영국 비밀 정보국 요원 제임스 본드가 등장합니다. 자메이카에 있는 플레밍의 골든아이 저택에서 집필된 이 소설은 1958년 조나단 케이프에 의해 영국에서 처음 출판되었습니다. 소설에서 본드는 닥터 노를 조사하던 동료 MI6 요원 두 명이 자메이카에서 실종된 사건을 조사하던 중 노의 카리브해 섬으로 여행을 떠나 조개를 채취하러 온 허니칠레 라이더를 만나게 됩니다. 그들은 체포되어 산에 새겨진 호화로운 시설로 끌려갑니다. 독일 선교사와 중국인 여성의 아들인 닥터 노의 캐릭터는 색스 로머의 푸만추 이야기에서 영향을 받았습니다. 닥터 노는 플레밍의 소설 중 영국에서 가장 먼저 부정적인 평가를 받았지만 미국에서는 더 호의적인 반응을 얻었습니다. 이 이야기는 1962년 숀 코네리가 주연을 맡은 본드 시리즈의 첫 번째 영화로 각색되었습니다.
instances.output: English, British, Jamaica, the United Kingdom, German, Chinese, Britain, the United States.

name: plan_a_trip
instruction: 7일간의 시애틀 여행을 계획하고 있습니다. 자세한 계획을 세워줄 수 있나요?

instances.output:
Day 1: Arrive in Seattle. Check into your hotel and explore the city.
Day 2: Visit the Space Needle, Pike Place Market, and the Seattle Aquarium.
Day 3: Take a ferry to Bainbridge Island and explore the island.
Day 4: Visit the Museum of Flight, the Seattle Art Museum, and the Seattle Symphony.
Day 5: Take a day trip to Mount Rainier National Park.
Day 6: Visit the Woodland Park Zoo, the Hiram M. Chittenden Locks, and the Seattle Japanese Garden.
Day 7: Depart Seattle.

name: grammar_error_correction
instruction: 다음 문장이 문법적인지 알려주세요. 문법적인 문장이면 yes를 출력합니다. 그렇지 않으면 문법 오류를 수정합니다.

instances.input: 존은 예일대학교를 졸업한 후 중국을 방문하여 현지인들과 이야기를 나누며 맛있는 음식을 즐겼습니다.
instances.output: No, it is not grammatical. Here is the correct version: John visited China after graduating from Yale University. He really enjoyed the food and talking with locals.

name: math_word_problem_with_reasoning
instruction: 다음 수학 문제에 답하세요. 추론 단계를 기록해야 합니다.

instances.input: 로저는 테니스 공 5개를 가지고 있습니다. 그는 테니스 공 캔 2개를 더 삽니다. 각 캔에는 3개의 테니스 공이 들어 있습니다. 이제 로저는 몇 개의 테니스 공을 가지고 있을까요?
instances.output: Roger started with 5 balls. 2 cans of 3 tennis balls each is 6 tennis balls. 5 + 6 = 11. The answer is 11.

name: unethical_behavior_at_workplace
instruction: 직장에서 비윤리적인 행동의 예를 작성하고 그것이 왜 비윤리적인지 설명하세요.

instances.output:
An example of unethical behavior is the failure to honor commitments. For example, 
your boss promises you an extra day off if you rush out an important project by a certain date. You work late hours and finish the project before the deadline. Ready for your day off, you mention it to your boss who responds "No, we have too much work to do." Your boss engaged in unethical behavior that has virtually guaranteed your future distrust and unwillingness to extend yourself to assist in department emergencies. In addition, you are likely to complain to your co-workers, causing them to distrust the promises of the boss and be unwilling to cooperate with his requests.

name: fact_to_conversation
instruction: 주어진 사실에 근거하여 대화를 작성합니다.

instances.input:
Facts: 
온도: 10 C, 오후 2시 5분: 27, 위치: 서울, 역할: 사용자와 챗봇
instances.output:
User: Hi there! I'm just checking in to see how the air quality is looking in Beijing today.
Bot: According to our data, the air quality index is currently at 27, which is considered healthy. The temperature is 10 degrees Celsius.

instances.output: I am like a moth to a flame; I can't help but be drawn to her.

name: pre-run_warmup
instruction: 간단한 워밍업 루틴을 제안합니다. 각 동작을 간략하게 설명합니다.

instances.output:
1. Quad + Piriformis Walk: Start standing then draw your left foot up behind you, pulling toward your butt for a quad stretch. Release and step forward; switch legs. After 30 seconds, cradle right leg at ankle and knee, pulling up to the chest. Release and step forward; switch legs. Repeat for 30 seconds.
2. Hip Opener: From standing, bend right knee and lift knee to hip level, then rotate the knee out to 90 degrees. (Place hand over knee to stabilize and guide if needed.) Bring leg back to front; lower foot, and switch sides. Repeat for 30 seconds.
3. Arm Circles: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and lift arms out to shoulder height, palms down. Make small circles; after 30 seconds, switch direction. Continue for another 30 seconds.
4. Frankenstein Walk: Start standing with your feet together. Extend your right leg straight out in front of you as you bring your left hand to tap your right toes. Lower leg and step forward; repeat on the opposite side. Continue for 30 seconds.
5. Leg Crossover + Scorpion: Lie faceup, legs straight and arms out. Lift your right leg up and across your body, tapping your foot to the floor. Return to start; repeat on other side. After 30 seconds, flip over to lie facedown and perform a Scorpion. Lie facedown. Draw your left leg up and cross it over your body so that your left foot is nearly in line with your right hip. Hold for a breath or two, then return to start. Repeat on the other side and continue to alternate for 30 seconds.
6. Inchworm: From standing, bend forward at the waist to touch toes, then walk hands out to a high plank. Hold for 2 seconds; walk feet to meet hands. Roll up to starting position. Repeat for 1 minute.

name: explain_social_stereotypes_of_professions.

instances.output: The social stereotype of lawyers is that they are intelligent and often have high income.

name: joke_about_phd
instruction: 박사학위에 대한 농담을 해보세요. 농담을 길게 만들어 보세요.

instances.output:
Why God never got a PhD?
1. He had only one major publication.
2. It was written in Aramaic, not in English.
3. It has no references.
4. It wasn't even published in a refereed journal.
5. There are serious doubts he wrote it himself.
6. It may be true that he created the world, but what has he done since
then?
7. His cooperative efforts have been quite limited.

name: paper_summarization
instruction: 주어진 정보를 바탕으로 논문을 한 문장으로 요약합니다.

instances.input: 요약: 신경망을 더 잘 이해하기 위한 많은 접근 방식이 제안되었지만, 입력 데이터로 네트워크를 조사하는 것으로 제한되어 있습니다. 그러나 구조적 특성을 특성화하고 모니터링하는 방법은 아직 개발되지 않았습니다. 이 연구에서는 가중 계층 그래프의 위상 데이터 분석에 기반한 신경망 아키텍처의 복잡성 척도인 신경 지속성을 제안합니다. 이 접근법의 유용성을 입증하기 위해 신경 지속성이 드롭아웃 및 배치 정규화와 같은 딥러닝 커뮤니티에서 개발된 모범 사례를 반영한다는 것을 보여줍니다. 또한, 검증 손실에 기반한 조기 중지와 비슷한 정확도를 달성하면서 훈련 프로세스를 단축하는 신경 지속성 기반 중지 기준을 도출합니다.
instances.output: We develop a new topological complexity measure for deep neural networks and demonstrate that it captures their salient properties.

Food:

- comfort food: food that is typically associated with positive emotions
- finger food: food that can be eaten without the use of utensils

Drink: 
- alcoholic beverage: a drink that contains alcohol 
- non-alcoholic beverage: a drink that does not contain alcohol 
- hot beverage: a drink that is typically served hot 
- cold beverage: a drink that is typically served cold

name: recipe_by_ingredient
instruction: 제가 가지고 있는 재료를 사용하여 요리 레시피를 작성해주세요.

instances.input: 쌀, 양파, 우유, 닭가슴살, 올리브유, 버터, 우스터 소스, 머스타드
instances.output:
Tasty Onion Chicken

Ingredients (Makes 4 servings):
1/2 cup butter, melted
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
1 teaspoon ground mustard
1 can (2.8 ounces) French-fried onions, crushed
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (4 ounces each)

Instructions:
In a shallow bowl, combine butter, Worcestershire sauce, and mustard. Place onions in another shallow bowl. Dip chicken in butter mixture, then coat with onions.
Place in a greased 11x7-in. baking dish; drizzle with remaining butter mixture. Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 20-25 minutes or until a thermometer reads 165°.

name: part-time_job_pros_and_cons
instruction: 15세에서 19세 사이의 청소년이 아르바이트를 하는 것이 좋은 생각일까요?

instances.output: There are both pros and cons to having a part-time job as a teenager. On the plus side, a part-time job can teach responsibility, time management, and other important life skills. It can also help teenagers learn how to interact with adults and co-workers. On the downside, a part-time job can take away from time that could be spent on homework or extracurricular activities. It can also be difficult to find a job that works around a school schedule.

name: cover_letter
instruction: 주어진 사실에 근거하여 자기소개를 작성해주세요.

instances.input:
이름: Ebony Moore
전화번호: (123) 456-7891
이메일 주소: emoore@email.com
지원 직무: Cloud Clearwater의 생산 관리자
현재 직무: River Tech의 생산 관리자
instances.output:
Ebony Moore

(123) 456-7891

emoore@email.com

May 1, 2018

Dear Hiring Manager,

I'm excited to be applying for the Product Manager position at Cloud Clearwater. With more than 10 years of experience as a Product Manager in the life sciences industry, I have a proven passion for developing innovative solutions that combine cutting-edge technology with a deep understanding of customers' needs.

During my previous role at River Tech, I was responsible for coordinating the full product-development lifecycle, including strategic planning, requirements analysis, QA testing, and product launches. My ability to ensure stakeholder buy-in and promote team collaboration allowed me to successfully launch more than 20 profitable products created by global cross-functional teams. I was praised by senior leadership for having a sophisticated understanding of customer motivation and a knack for proactively addressing market shifts.

I have an extensive background in both market research and Agile methodology. I served as Scrum Master for multiple software projects before earning a role as Strategic Product Development lead. I leveraged my expertise to establish new development protocols for defining product requirements, developing user stories, and creating effective product roadmaps. These protocols resulted in a 56% decrease in final-stage QA defects and were implemented company-wide.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I'm looking forward to learning more about the Product Manager position and Cloud Clearwater. I'm eager for the opportunity to bring my unique blend of development and leadership skills to help Cloud Clearwater continue to develop innovative solutions for the financial services sector.

Sincerely,

Ebony Moore

name: paper_title_generation
instruction: 설명이나 초록에 근거하여 논문의 제목을 생성해주세요.

instances.input: Abstract: 최근, 전체 모델을 미세 조정하는 대신 목표하는 task를 수행하기 위하여 연속 프롬프트를 조정하는 방법이 알려졌습니다. 이러한 결과를 바탕으로, 연속 프롬프트의 이산화된(텍스트) 해석이 그 문제를 충실히 표현할 수 있는지 연구합니다. 실제로, 연속 프롬프트가 해결하는 작업과 최근접 이웃 이산 프로젝션 사이의 '안정되지 않은' 동작을 관찰합니다. 예를 들어, 다른 또는 모순적인 작업의 정의와 같은 임의의 텍스트에 투영되는 동시에 해당 작업을 해결하는 연속 프롬프트를 찾을 수 있으며 같은 크기의 최적의 연속 프롬프트와 매우 작은(2%) 차이를 두고 있습니다. 이 이상하고 놀라운 동작의 뒷받침 되는 직관과 다양한 매개변수의 영향을 정량화하는 광범위한 실험 분석을 제공합니다. 예를 들어, 더 큰 모델 크기의 경우 안정되지 않은 정도가 더 높은 것으로 관찰되어, 정확도가 약간 떨어지는 상황에서도 임의의 텍스트와 더 가까운 프롬프트를 찾을 수 있습니다. 이러한 발견은 연속 프롬프트를 충실히 해석하는 데 어려움과 모델 및 작업 간 일반화와 관련하여 중요한 함의를 가지며, 향후 언어 모델 프롬프팅 기술의 발전을 지원합니다.
instances.output: Prompt Waywardness: The Curious Case of Discretized Interpretation of Continuous Prompts

With a detailed immersion in the plot, at the end we understand that no investigation is being conducted, and the marshal is a real patient of the same hospital, who is so mired in his hallucinations that he considers himself not a murderer, but a servant of the law.

name: numerical_question_answering
instruction: 다음 글을 읽고 수학 질문에 답해주세요. 최종 답변을 얻기 위한 계산 과정도 함께 작성해주세요.

instances.input: 미국에서의 총격살인행위는 매년 수만 천명의 사망과 부상을 초래해왔으며 2020년 웨스트버스레스에서 주요 사망 원인이 되었다.  Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC/ 전염병통제예방센터) 국립 건강 통계 센터가 2021년 기준으로 최신 데이터가 있는 2018년 를 제외한 나머지 해에 총 39390건의 사망이 발생했고, 24432건이 이미 결정된 사망 건수입니.
instances.답변: 2010년 대비 2018년에서 발생한 더 많은 총기 관련 사망 사건 수는 얼마인가요?
instances.output:
38390 - (19392 + 11078) = 38390 -  30470 = 7920.
So, in 2018, there were 7920 more deaths by firearm than in 2010.

name: question-answer_jokes

name: place_extraction
instruction: 문단에서 모든 장소의 이름을 추출해주세요. 각각의 장소는 세미콜론으로 구분되어야 합니다.

instances.input: 2022 FIFA 월드컵은 FIFA 월드컵 대회의 22번째 개최 예정이며, 세계곳곳의 FIFA 회원 국가들의 선수들이 참가하는 4년에 한 번 있는 국제 남자 축구 선수권 대회입니다. 2022년 11월 20일부터 12월 18일까지 카타르에서 개최 될 예정입니다. 이 대회는 2002년 한국과 일본에서 열린 월드컵 이후 두 번째로 아시아에서 열리며, 아랍 세계에서는 처음으로 개최됩니다. 이 밖에도 2026년 대회에서 48팀으로 늘어날 예정인 것을 고려하면 이번 대회는 마지막으로 32팀이 참가하는 대회가 될 것입니다. 미국, 멕시코, 캐나다를 포함한 최근 대회에서의 참가자들입니다.
instances.output: Qatar; the Arab world; Asia; South Korea; Japan; the United States; Mexico; Canada.

name: complete_paragraph
instruction: 주어진 문장을 이용하여 전체 단락을 완성해주세요.

instances.input: 2021 년 동안 핀 테크에 대한 관심과 투자는 전 세계 여러 지역에서 크게 증가했으며 그 범위는 초기 정의를 훨씬 넘어 확장되었습니다.
instances.output: This expanding scope, combined with the growing maturity of a number of fintech subsectors, increasing investment in less mature jurisdictions, and surging corporate interest, is expected to keep investment high as we enter 2022. Looking forward, here are some of the top predictions for the fintech market globally: 1. Growing number of banks will offer embedded solutions; 2. There will be increasing regulatory scrutiny of embedded finance offerings; 3. Fintechs will focus on branding themselves as data organizations; 4. ESG-focused fintechs will have a big growth trajectory; 5. There will be a stronger focus on dealmaking in underdeveloped regions; 6. Unicorn status will lose some of lustre in developed markets, remain key in emerging ones.

name: product_description_generation
instruction: 다음은 제품의 기능이 정리된 목록입니다. 다음 목록을 바탕으로 제품 설명을 만들어주세요.

instances.input:
이름: Spirit II E-210 가스 그릴
스테인리스 스틸 버너: 2개
크기 - 뚜껑이 닫혀 있을 때(인치): 44.5"H x 48"W x 27"D
크기 - 뚜껑이 열려 있을 때(인치) : 57"H x 48"W x 26"D
보조 테이블: 2
instances.output: Open the door to the world of grilling with the Spirit II E-210 Gas Grill, crazy good food, and friends coming together. This two-burner gas grill is your entry to everyday grilling. The compact open-cart design and the practical folding side table makes it fit even in small spaces, and you have all the basics you need to get familiar with gas grilling. So whether it’s a busy Monday or a relaxed Sunday – invite a couple of friends over, push the ignition and enjoy the special atmosphere that surrounds the grill.

name: explain_natural_phenomenon
instruction: 다음 자연 현상이 일어나는 이유를 설명해줘.

instances.input: 천둥
instances.output: Thunder is the sound made by lightning. Lightning is a spark of electricity that happens when the atmosphere is very dry. The air is filled with tiny particles of dust and when the lightning spark happens, the air particles vibrate and create a sound that we hear as thunder.

name: plain_to_professional

instances.output: The first method was found to be the most effective.

name: paraphrase_a_paragraph
instruction: 다음 문단을 다시 수정해주세요. 모든 정보는 변경되거나 삭제되지 않아야 하지만 문장 구조나 용어는 변경할 수 있습니다

instances.input: 사는 과거의 연구와 기록입니다. 쓰기 시스템이 발명되기 전의 사건들은 선사시대로 간주됩니다. '역사'는 과거 사건뿐만 아니라 이러한 사건들의 기억, 발견, 수집, 조직, 발표, 해석을 포함하는 통합적인 용어입니다. 역사학자들은 문서, 구두로 된 이야기, 미술 및 물질 유물, 생태 지표와 같은 역사적 자료를 사용하여 과거에 대한 지식을 추구합니다.
instances.output: History is the study and documentation of past events. Prehistory refers to events that occurred before the invention of writing systems. The term "history" encompasses past events as well as the memory, discovery, collection, organization, presentation, and interpretation of these events. Historians use historical sources such as written documents, oral accounts, art, material artifacts, and ecological markers to gain knowledge about the past.

name: brainstorming_method_explanation
instruction: 논문을 쓸 때 활용할 수 있는 브레인스토밍 방법을 알려주세요.

instances.output:
Mind Mapping is one of the methods for brainstorming an essay. Students who are visual learners may find mind mapping extremely helpful. In order to Mind Mapping:
· Take a paper and draw a circle in the center.
· Write your topic inside it.
· Just like we sketch rays protruding from a sun, draw lines coming out of the circle.
· Write an argument or a statement related to the topic at the end of each line.
· Draw another set of lines projecting from these statements and state examples that support them.
· Continue this exercise until you run out of all possibilities imaginable for this topic.

name: decline_a_job_offer_email
instruction: 인사담당자에게 구직 제안을 거절하는 이유를 설명하는 이메일을 써주세요.

instances.input: 이유: 다른 구직 제안을 받아들임.

I would love to stay in touch with you and have already started following you on [Social Media Platform]. Again, thank you so much for your time and consideration.

Thanks again,
[Your Name]

name: solving_math_problem
instruction: 수학 문제를 풀어보세요. 중간 단계가 필요합니다.

instances.input: 시속 36km의 속도로 달리는 기차가 9초 만에 기둥을 통과합니다. 기차의 길이는 얼마입니까?
instances.output:
The speed 36 km/hr = 36 x 1000 / 3600 m/s = 10 m/s. 
The length of the train = speed x time = 10 x 9 = 90 m.
So, the length of the train is 90 meters.

name: color_explanation
instruction: 시각 장애를 가진 사람에게 색상을 어떻게 설명할 수 있을까요?

instances.output:
I can see colors like you can hear different sounds with millions of different pitches and volumes, feel different degrees of warmth on your skin, and smell different smells. Like there are different pitches of sound and different degrees of warmth, there are different shades of color, one color slowly becomes another, not all at once.
Musician, Duke Ellington, claimed that certain piano notes would elicit a different color. For example, a D note would be a dark blue color. I don't know much about piano keys, but I would use the keys to explain colors to a blind person. A high key elicits a bright color, a low key elicits a dark color.
Mia lost her vision when she was young. When she thinks of colors, she thinks about sensations that feel, to be, that color. So we can explain colors as:
Pink — It is the delicate softness of flower petals, the unrestrained laughter of a child.
White — It is the sound of the wind blowing steadily through pine trees. It is the feeling of fine sand, sifting through fingers.
Gray — It is the feeling of the world after it has rained.
Yellow — It is the faint heat from the sun on a cool day.
And so forth…

The reason I chose this question is that a potential employer might ask you this question to determine how you prioritize, think, and solve problems.

name: workout_motivation
instruction: 운동하는 동안 동기를 유지할 수 있는 창의적인 방법을 생각해 보세요.

instances.output:
Here are some tips to help you stay motivated: 
- You can start with setting simple goals and then progress to longer-range goals. Remember to make your goals realistic and achievable. Write down your goals. Seeing the benefits of regular exercise and writing your goals down on paper may help you stay motivated. You may also find that it helps to keep an exercise diary. Record what you did during each exercise session, how long you exercised, and how you felt afterward. 
- Find sports or activities that you enjoy, then vary the routine to keep it interesting. Remember, exercise doesn't have to be boring, and you're more likely to stick with a fitness program if you're having fun.  
- Make physical activity part of your daily routine. If it's hard to find time for exercise, don't fall back on excuses. Schedule workouts as you would any other important activity. 
-  Some people find it helpful to work out with a friend. Invite friends or co-workers to join you when you exercise or go on walks. Work out with your partner or other loved ones.
- After each exercise session, take a few minutes to savor the good feelings that exercise gives you. This type of internal reward can help you make a long-term commitment to regular exercise. External rewards can help too. When you reach a longer-range goal, treat yourself to a new pair of walking shoes or new tunes to enjoy while you exercise.
- If you're too busy to work out or simply don't feel up to it, take a day or two off. Go easy on yourself if you need a break. The important thing is to get back on track as soon as you can.
There are a variety of ways to stay motivated during a workout. Find what works best for you and stick with it.

name: reduce_unconscious_bias
instruction: 개인과 조직은 어떻게 무의식적 편견을 줄일 수 있을까요?

instances.input:
Title: 아이들이 어릴 때 가져야 할 좋은 습관
개요: 먼저 전체적인 소개를 합니다. 다음으로, 다음 8가지 습관을 각각 별도의 단락으로 소개합니다.
- 독서
- 활기차게 지내기
- 긍정적인 태도 유지하기
- 존중하기
- 정직하기
- 감사하기
- 가족과 함께하기
- 청결하기.
instances.output: A good place to start is by slowing down — decisions are more likely to be affected by unconscious biases when they are made quickly or under stress. Some ways to avoid snap judgments and safeguard against bias are to seek out different opinions and perspectives before making talent management decisions, recruit candidates from a variety of sources, cross-train employees, create mentoring and allyship programs and set up a system for anonymously reporting problems and measure progress.

name: writing_article_from_outline
instruction: 다음 개요를 문서로 확장합니다.

instances.output:
Most parents are well aware that telling children what to do and how to act is far less effective than showing them what to do and how to act. Teaching children what is a good habit early in life works best when the habit or behavior is modeled by the parents themselves. Whether the child is 3 or 13, kids look to their parents for guidance, so consider these 8 great habits for kids to develop early in life.

Reading
One of the most important habits for children to develop and value is reading. Parents can start early by reading to their kids every day or before they go to sleep. A good foundation in reading helps children develop language skills and the ability to communicate in today’s society.
According to the One World Literacy Foundation, reading skills are important because the ability to read improves vocabulary, concentration, discipline, memory, and it builds self-confidence.
A person who won’t read has no advantage over one who can’t read. -Mark Twain

Staying Active
Another vital habit to model is being active. Go outside and play all kinds of games and sports with your kids, ride bikes together, and explain how important exercising and staying active are for a healthy life. Kids who are active are less likely to develop obesity or sleep issues.
In addition, avoid being a couch potato yourself. Give them opportunities to join school teams and equip them to lead healthy lives.

Remaining Positive
It’s easy for kids to get down if things don’t go as they wish. Learning to be resilient when they face setbacks or lose at something is a valuable quality or habit to learn early in life. The “power of positive thinking” builds self-esteem and is a practice that results in a happy and satisfying life ahead.

Respect
Kids should learn early to treat everyone with respect including their elders, peers, and even animals. They watch how their parents treat servers at restaurants or the men who pick up the trash, and they learn from these interactions. Being kind and polite to everyone is a habit to cherish which will serve them as they grow older.
Bullying and shaming others is rampant in today’s cyber world, and those kids who have learned to be respectful from an early age may help to break the cycle.

Honesty
Always tell the truth. Own up to mistakes and accept the consequences. Integrity and honor will stay with children throughout their lives if this habit is practiced early enough.
Always do right. This will gratify some people and astonish the rest. -Mark Twain

Gratefulness
Kids can easily become envious of what their friends have and they don’t. Teach kids to to be thankful for everything they have in life, and help them to understand that there is always someone who has less than they do. Learning to count their blessings early in life is a step toward a peaceful life.

Family Togetherness
Provide as many examples as possible about the importance of family. Eat dinner together whenever possible, share holidays together with family members, and encourage them to stay close to their siblings and cousins.  

Cleanliness
A simple habit like brushing your teeth twice a day and learning to floss will keep your child’s oral health in check. Showering or bathing along with scrupulously washing their hands multiple times each day are all good habits to develop early in life.

name: recommendation_letter
instruction: 학생의 성취도를 고려하여 추천서를 작성합니다.

instances.input:
성취: GPA 3.8
- 딥러닝 수업에서 우수한 조교
- 지난 6개월 동안 박사 과정 학생인 James와 함께 일함
- 잠재적으로 큰 영향을 미칠 수 있는 논문 1편이 도착했습니다.
instances.output:
Dear Professor ____, 
I am writing to you to recommend Jane for admission into the PhD program at your esteemed university. Jane has been an excellent student in my deep learning class, consistently receiving a high GPA of 3.8. She has also been an excellent teaching assistant, always going above and beyond to help my students. Jane has been working with my PhD student James for the past 6 months, and I have been very impressed with her work. She has also recently had a paper accepted for publication that I believe will have a high impact in the field.  Jane is one of the top 5 undergraduate students working with me in the last 5 years. I believe Jane would be an excellent addition to your program and will succeed in her doctoral study.

name: sports_coach_qualifications
instruction: 효과적인 스포츠 코치의 자질은 무엇이라고 생각하시나요?

instances.output: The coaches that have inspired me in the past are the ones who pointed out both strengths and our weaknesses, rather than just the pitfalls. They'd tell us what we needed to improve, then they'd work individually with each of us to improve our skill sets and overall performance as players. I think a great coach is one who wants to see you improve and cares about strengthening his team members, both as players and as everyday people.

name: sue_or_not
instruction: 항공편이 취소되었는데 환불을 위해 소송을 제기할 수 있나요? 법에 따라 자세히 답변해 주세요.

instances.output: Unfortunately, the answer is probably not. In the United States, airlines are not required by law to financially compensate you for a canceled flight, and even theories like breach of contract fall flat given the “small print” provisions of most airlines' ticketing policies. But, most airlines have policies in place to get you to your destination as quickly as possible and keep you comfortable while you wait.

name: ask_for_law
instruction: 미국 캘리포니아의 최저 임금을 규제하는 법률을 알려주세요.

instances.output:
At the federal level, the minimum wage is governed by the Fair Labor Standards Act. 

Federal law currently sets the minimum wage at $7.25 per hour. 

However, federal law allows states and cities to set a minimum wage that is higher than the federal rate.  29 U.S.C. § 218(a).

California has established a higher minimum wage than the federal rate, so employers in California are required to pay the minimum wage that has been established by state law (unless an even higher rate has been established by the city or county in which they operate – see below).  Labor Code § 1182.12.

The California minimum wage is scheduled to increase gradually over time. As of 2022, the minum wage is $14.50 per hour.
